error.signature: An error occurred (LimitExceededException) when calling the X operation

verdict.summary: AWS service limit reached. Each service has default limits that can be increased.

dead_ends.why_fails: Limits apply per-account but new accounts have LOWER limits
Limits are usually per-region but this isn't a real solution

workarounds.action: Request a limit increase through AWS Service Quotas console
workarounds.how:
# Via CLI:
aws service-quotas request-service-quota-increase \
  --service-code ec2 \
  --quota-code L-1216C47A \
  --desired-value 100

# Or open the Service Quotas console: https://console.aws.amazon.com/servicequotas/
# Navigate to the service, find the quota, and click 'Request quota increase'. Approval typically takes 1-3 business days.

workarounds.action: Check current usage: aws service-quotas list-service-quotas
Clean up unused resources to free capacity under the limit
workarounds.how:
# List resources to identify unused ones. Examples:
aws ec2 describe-instances --filters Name=instance-state-name,Values=stopped
aws ec2 describe-addresses --filters Name=association-id,Values=''
aws ec2 describe-snapshots --owner-ids self --query 'Snapshots[?StartTime<`2024-01-01`]'

# Use AWS Trusted Advisor or Cost Explorer to identify idle resources. Terminate stopped instances, release unassociated EIPs, and delete old snapshots.

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'An error occurred (LimitExceededException) when ca' is a quota_error error while 'You have requested more vCPU capacity than your cu' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
